channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: The street light on the pavement as I come out of Melanie close is right in the middle and I can’t get through on my mobility scooter. I almost got hit my a car reversing as I went in to the road to avoid it., 5th October
item.description:
This street light needs moving to allow people like me who uses a mobility scooter to get past on the pavement safely. If I’m in my wheelchair I can’t be pushed safely past and a double pushchair wouldn’t be able to get past either. I don’t choose to use a wheelchair but it’s not safe to be pushed in the road when I have to use it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melanie Close, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People obstructing pavement by selling stuff outside Halifax - Seven Sisters Road N7 6BW, 5th October
item.description:
Every Saturday and Sunday the strip of Pavement outside Halifax 17/19 Seven Sisters Rd, London N7 6BW has people causing an obstruction on the pavement by selling stuff. They are now setting up tables and once a crowd gathers the whole pavement is obstructed and pedestrians need to walk into the road to get past. Please can you sort this weekly nuisance out once and for all.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hercules Place, Holloway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mattress and rubbish have been left obstructing the pavement, 5th October
item.description:
There is an ongoing issue of fly-tipping in this area. Large items, such as the mattress shown in the picture, fridges, and broken toilets, along with other rubbish, are frequently left on the pavement. This not only obstructs pedestrian access but also creates an unsightly and unhygienic environment for residents. Despite repeated occurrences, no signs or CCTV cameras have been installed by the council to discourage this behaviour. The problem has been ongoing for several months now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cottingham Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic is released too early from Southwood Rd under a green traffic light in direct conflict with traffic turning right at right angles from the A20 Sidcup Rd into Green Lane due to faulty traffic light sequence. item.description:

item.title: Drug use in bin room, 5th October
item.description:
The Chaplin apartments bin room has been targeted by homeless individuals to smoke crack and now sleep in the whole year. Not only does our fire alarm go off middle of the night, but individuals are now targeting residents to let them in
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sylvester Path, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
